str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Vocative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
To commit adultery (of a man with a married woman, but also of a married man). From moichos; to commit adultery.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To commit adultery (of a man with a married woman, but also of a married man). From moichos; to commit adultery.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Vocative Masculine Singular
str2: To abhor, detest, loathe. From a derivative of bdeo; to be disgusted, i.e. detest.
An idol, false god. From eidos; an image; by implication, a heathen god, or the worship of such.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To commit sacrilege, rob a temple. From hierosulos; to be a temple-robber.
